content: It came up in https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80874 that the rustdoc book is not a great place for all the details of how rustdoc behaves, because it's meant to be a guide more than a reference. Is there anything about rustdoc in the reference? If not, would you be interested in me adding some info?
do you mean things like the doc attribute being in the reference? yeah that should be
that, and also how rustdoc behaves really strangely sometimes: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/80874#issuecomment-777696740
like I don't think the word "inlining" is mentioned in any documentation at all currently

I would prefer to keep the reference to be about the language, and less about the tools. I think it would be reasonable just to add chapters to the rustdoc book. As an example, the Cargo Book includes a separate Guide and Reference section.
oh yeah, precisely how rustdoc renders is well outside the reference's scope
It is enough to say "there are these attributes here, they work like this, and you can read more here (link)"
